frontmatter.title: Automatic cloud backups
frontmatter.description: Performing scheduled backups to an external filestore such as those provided by Amazon or Google will improve your elasticity in response to an attack. Remember to follow data storage laws and only backup the necessary data.

frontmatter.title: Manual backup to separate device, kept elsewhere
Every device in scope must have a firewall.
Block unauthenticated inbound connections by default
Change default administrative password on firewalls
Disable remote administrative access to firewalls entirely
Use IP Allowlists (Whitelists) on Firewalls and block all other connections by default.
Multi-Factor Authentication on Firewalls
Prevent access to the administrative interface from the Internet, unless there is a clear and documented business need.
Create a log of all of the data that is important to the organisation
frontmatter.description: Use write-only logging on your company systems to track access and maintain an audit log that can be used to track who accessed what and when.

frontmatter.title: Install Antivirus on staff PCs
Sandbox applications
Scan web pages automatically when they are accessed through a web browser
Configure regular scans of devices and the network for malware.
Ensure devices and software (especially antivirus) are set to auto update
Allow access to a specific set of websites, block everything else.
Do not allow applications that are not unsigned, have an invalid signature or do not match your organisations software whitelist.
Authenticate users before granting access to applications or devices
Change default or weak account passwords
Ensure appropriate device locking controls - biometric, password or PIN before gaining access to the services. Biometric tests, passwords and PINs.
Disable any auto run feature which allows file execution without user authorisation
Remove or disable unnecessary software
Remove or disable user accounts when no longer required, in particular special access accounts
Wait between attempts increases with each unsuccessful attempt. This should permit no more than 10 guesses in 5 minutes
Implement MFA, where avaliable
Lock accounts after no more than 10 unsuccessful attempts

A minimum password length of at least 12 characters, with no maximum length restrictions - use automatic blocking of common passwords using a deny list, promote the use of strong password standards (education)
Providing usable secure storage for passwords, e.g password manager
Use separate accounts to perform administrative activities only
Enforce Two-Factor Authentication across your Organisation.
